SEARCH
Module FloWeekTracker
Package com.floweektracker.planner

Class PlannerDataManager

java.lang.Object
com.floweektracker.planner.PlannerDataManager
Direct Known Subclasses:
PlannerTableManager
public class PlannerDataManager extends Object
Represents data management for a weekly planner. This class manages tasks scheduled in the planner and supports saving/loading operations from a Planner.json.

Fields:
  • gson - a Gson reference used in I/O operations
  • plannerFile - a File reference representing the Planner.json file containing planner data
  • planners - a HashMap containing tasks sorted by each day of the week
  • weekDays - an array of all the WeekDays enum values
I/O operations:
  • loadPlanner() - loads tasks from the Planner.json file
  • savePlanner() - saves planners to the Planner.json file
Task management operations:
  • addTask() - adds a task to the planners
  • cleanPlanner(HashSet, String) - based on parameters, removes tasks or resets points for the specified days of the week
  • deleteTask(String, String) - removes a task from the planners
  • editTask(String, String) - edits a task in the planners
Getters: getPlanners()

  • Field Details

    • planners

      private HashMap<String,HashMap<String,SingleTaskManager>> planners
      Contains tasks sorted by each day of the week. Each key in the outer HashMap represents a day of the week as a String (e.g. "Monday"). The value associated with each day is another HashMap where the String represents an hour, and SingleTaskManager represents a task.

      Example usage: 
      
 String weekDay = "MONDAY";
 String hour = "12:30";

 HashMap<String, SingleTaskManager> weekDaySchedule = planners.get(weekDay);
 SingleTaskManager task = weekDaySchedule.get(hour);
      See Also:
      • PlannerDataManager()
      • loadPlanner()
      • savePlanner()
      • addTask()
      • editTask(String, String)
      • deleteTask(String, String)
      • cleanPlanner(HashSet, String)
      • getPlanners()
      • PlannerTableManager

    • weekDays

      private final WeekDays[] weekDays
      Contains an array of the enum values from the WeekDays. This array holds all the constants of the WeekDays enum in the order they are declared.
      See Also:
      • PlannerDataManager()
      • cleanPlanner(HashSet, String)

    • plannerFile

      private final File plannerFile
      Contains the Planner.json file reference used to store planners data. This file is utilized for loading and saving user-entered data within the application.
      See Also:
      • PlannerDataManager()
      • loadPlanner()
      • savePlanner()

    • gson

      private final com.google.gson.Gson gson
      Contains the Gson object used for loading and saving data from the plannerFile.
      See Also:
      • PlannerDataManager()
      • loadPlanner()
      • savePlanner()

  • Constructor Details

    • PlannerDataManager

      PlannerDataManager()
      Constructs a new PlannerDataManager instance. This constructor initializes references to plannerFile and gson. It checks if the file exists. If it does, the loadPlanner() method is invoked. If not, a new planners instance is initialized with empty mappings for each WeekDays, and the savePlanner() method is called to create the file.

  • Method Details

    • loadPlanner

      private void loadPlanner()
      Loads data from the plannerFile and assigns it to planners. May throw an IOException if there's an issue with input/output operations.
      See Also:
      • PlannerDataManager()

    • savePlanner

      public void savePlanner()
      Saves user-entered data from planners to the plannerFile. May throw an IOException if there's an issue with input/output operations.
      See Also:
      • MainListeners.configureWindowsAdapter()
      • PlannerDataManager()

    • addTask

      public boolean addTask()
      Adds task to the planners by creating and displaying a new TaskAddingDialogUI dialog.
      Returns:
      true if the task was successfully added, otherwise false
      See Also:
      • PlannerTableManager
      • MainListeners.createButtonsListener()

    • editTask

      public boolean editTask(String weekDayPL, String time)
      Edits the task chosen by the user by creating and displaying a new TaskEditingDialogUI dialog. The passed parameters are used to get chosen task from the planners.
      Parameters:
      weekDayPL - a String representing the Polish name of the weekday chosen by the user
      time - a String representing the time of the task chosen by the user
      Returns:
      true if the task was successfully edited, false otherwise
      See Also:
      • MainListeners.createPlannerListener()

    • deleteTask

      public boolean deleteTask(String weekDayPL, String time)
      Deletes the task chosen by the user from planners. The passed parameters are used to locate and remove the chosen task.
      Parameters:
      weekDayPL - a String representing the Polish name of the weekday chosen by the user
      time - a String representing the time of the task chosen by the user
      Returns:
      true if the planners still contains the deleted task, false otherwise
      See Also:
      • MainListeners.deleteTask()

    • cleanPlanner

      public void cleanPlanner(HashSet<String> checkedWeekDays, String buttonName)
      Removes all tasks or resets all points from the chosen weekdays in planners. This method uses Stream to filter weekdays from weekDays matching the values from the passed checkedWeekDays parameter. Depending on the buttonName parameter, all tasks or points in the filtered schedules are either deleted or reset.
      Parameters:
      checkedWeekDays - a HashSet containing weekdays chosen by the user
      buttonName - a String representing the name of the button clicked by the user ("Wyczyść planer" to clear all tasks, "Wyzeruj punkty" to reset all points)
      See Also:
      • MainListeners.cleanPlanner(String)

    • getPlanners

      public HashMap<String,HashMap<String,SingleTaskManager>> getPlanners()
      Returns:
      planners containing user-entered tasks for each day of the week
      See Also:
      • MainListeners.createPlannerListener()
      • PlannerTableManager()
